#Text=DORSETSHIRE,
#Text=To Iron Founders, Millwrights, Engineers, and Capitalists, \\Most Advantageous and Desirable BUSINESS to be Disposed of, together with Valuable FREEHOLD PROPERTY, which
#Text=Will be SOLD by PRIVATE CONTRACT, In Three Lots, situate in the Parish of ALLINGTON, adjoining BRIDPORT, Dorsetshire; (the Proprietor retiring on account of ill health.)

#Text=Lot 1 All those extensive and convenient PREMISES, called The Itridport Foundry, containing rooms fur fitting up machinery, work rooms, store rooms, lathe, smith’s and carpenter’s shops; the /moulding shop is spacious, with a powerful crane, drying stove, coke oven, &c.
#Text=The water wheel, driving geer, blowers, lathes, &c. are driven by a fine stream of water, arid well found in every respect, having lately been made new at a considerable expense.

#Text=The business, which has been successfully carried on upwards of 30 years, is now. and will be kept until disposed ef. in active employment; and the power may be sufficient, independent of what is required tor the purposes ot the foundry, to drive a boiling, bone, grist, or paper mill.

#Text=A convenient DWELLING HOUSE adjoins it, comprising parlour, hall, kitchen, back-kitchen, larder, cellar, and five bedrooms; a counting house looking into the foundry yard, and flower garden in front of the house.
#Text=Near to the above is about an ACRE of very rich PASTURE and GARDEN LAND, with a stable, barn, and other buildings thereon; this lot combining altogether advantages which seldom otter for sa’«.
#Text=Lot 2—THREE DWELLING HOUSES, with Garden to each, contiguous to Lot I. in the occupation of the I*oreman and others employed in the foundry.
#Text=Their situation renders them an ■eligible investment.

#Text=Lot 3 consists of THREE CLOSES of L \\ ND. contiguous to Lot 1, viz. one Meadow, one Arable, and one Pasture, containing together about 11 Acres ; a part of which is well adapted tor building, as it commands a beautiful and picturesque view over a line wooded country.
#Text=The whole of the above Properties are adjoining the Turnpike London Road, leading from Bridport to Exeter.
#Text=Early possession will be given ; and every facility and encouragement aftorded to the Purchaser.
#Text=Part of the Purchase Money nny remain on the Properties if required.
#Text=Should the above Properties not be Sold, they will in that case be Let.
#Text=A Map of the Property may be ha 1, and particulars known on application to Mr.
#Text=Joseph Gai.pin, Surveyor, Btidport.
#Text=Bridpoht, Ist September, 1838. /
